intro: Diplazium altissimum, commonly known as the giant chain fern, is a member of the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its large, compound fronds that can reach lengths of up to 3 meters. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit, with both fertile and sterile fronds arising from the same rhizome. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with a distinctive, elongated shape and a smooth, waxy surface. Diplazium altissimum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as tropical and subtropical forests.
